Reviews.Title: “Not in the center of Rome...”
Reviews.Author: travelnicely190499
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome in October 2011. We were by our travelagency promiced a hotel in the center of Rome, and a 3 star hotel. Kent Hotel was not in the center of rome, its barly in the map of the center of Rome, and you should expect almost 30 minutes by bus, or 15-20 minutes by taxi to get to the "real" center of Rome. We did not experience this hotel to be a 3'star hotel. The people who worked at the hotel was really helpful. They did not speak good english, but were able to understand and speak in a such matter that we also understood what they tried to say. They explained how to get to the different parts of the city, and wrote down which bus to take where. The rooms were fine. Clean, relatively big, nicely decorated, and a ok bathroom with hairdryer. The beds were hard as rocks. There was a small TV, with only italian channels. -But who travels to Rome to watch TV anyway? ;) The area was quiet, and there was no noice in the hotell during our stay. The free WIFI did not work in the 3.floor where we had our room. So if you are depending on having free internet-access, you should ask to get a room in the 1. or 2. floor. The breakfast was the worst part of this hotell. Cold coffie, toast, dry crossaints, jam and nutello. We only ate breakfast one morning during our stay, and I reccomand you to order without breakfast. (If you are staying at a B&B in Rome, you have to pay 3 euro/night/person in tax. You must pay directly to the hotel when you are leaving). The breakfast was not worth it. All in all, I reccomand a hotell closer to the center of rome so you don't have to use so much time on transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in peaceful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Mette S
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights i Hotel Kent and was met by a very accommodating staff in the 100 years old building. The rooms were clean, the beds good and the bathrooms very modern with all amenities neccesary. We loved the fact that the hotel is placed in a residential area because there are lots of reataurants, trattorias and gelaterias.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back again”
Reviews.Author: LeRegardEloigne
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in Rome and stayed in three hotels. Hotel Kent was much nicer even than the 4-star-200-Euro-per-night-Hotel close to the glamourous via Veneto. The staff was very friendly and helpful, room was clean and with reasonable comfort. Typical Italian breakfast, that means very basic, but absolutely ok. We liked the area around the hotel and we went back a couple of times because its a nice location with few tourists, nice shops and authentic roman nightlive. Nevertheless, it is close enough to explore the center.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated!!!! Under delivered!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Narad
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, overpriced for the amenities provided (maybe it is the real estate), located close to Porta Pia a transport hub. Hotel switches off airconditioning many times a day claiming either housekeeping is being done or temperatures are falling. Resident comfort be damned. Not even drinking glasses provided in the rooms. Only one reception staff (Mr. Valentino) was a helpful person. The breakfast was very basic and was served by the surliest, most offensive waitress I have ever encountered. Choose to stay here only if nothing else works out.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Basic”
Reviews.Author: i_heart_vaykays
Reviews.Content: This was probably the most basic hotel I've ever stayed in. I travel alone a lot and the room here made me feel very lonely and nervous. There was A/C, but it didn't seem to cool the room down too much. There was a small tv and free wireless internet - which is always nice! Breakfast is served in a nice little room, which was nicely sunlit in the summer. Again, very basic. But yummy and just enough to get you started. It's across the street from the modern art museum. I didn't visit it, but quite convenient for those with an interest. It's about a 10 minute walk to the metro, which isn't too bad. Romans have a completely different sense of time though. Overall, the hotel is perfectly fine if you're traveling with others or aren't spending much time in the room. The staff is great - very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Guest0987
Reviews.Content: A bit (a bit) out of the touristic center but area is well served with transport. Double room of adequate size for Rome, nothing special but nice and with all necessary stuff. Breakfast was disappointing, don't wait more than just coffee and a croissant (those were ok though). Nice pizzeria just next to the hotel, Rinascente department store is very close also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dimka D
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel, but if you're really looking for a hotel in the heart of the city - you'll be a little disappointed. As pointed before - cleaning lady doesn't bother about making bed or changing the sheets, but anyway - it's a nice place and nice stuff is working there. And...if you want to eat good in Rome - go to plaza Mignanelli, 24 to the restaurant with the same name - just don't forget they're working very hard (I think because owners are too greedy to take some more waiters) so be patient in case if waiter confused your meal with someone else's:)We didn't had such a problem and everything was fantastic, but people on the other table seemed to get everything they didn't order:)

Reviews.Title: “Small and Sweet”
Reviews.Author: CC85
Reviews.Content: Kent Hotel is located right next to the Ocean Drive. Great customer service. Nice room size for 2 people. TV, radio, DVD player and even some CDs are included in the room. You get what you need for a nice weekend stay. I especially loved the purple walls!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: CGL79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10 min walk from the nearest metro stop, but there are buses you can take if you have heavy bags. Quite centrally located though, and is in a quiet street. The room and bathroom were very clean and admittedly they were small, but this is absolutely fine if you just want to use the place as a base for a short stay. Reception and breakfast room staff were nice and polite. Breakfast area is very small and food on offer is basic, but you can have as much as you like. The restaurant 50 yards up the road is very good and packed with the locals, which is always a good sign! Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a short stay outside the crowded centre of the city, but close enough to be convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Rail_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Be warned there are a few steps up to the reception. There is a really friendly receptionist who told us exactly where to find all the sights and which buses to catch. Breakfast was simple with only toast, crispbreads and jams and chocolate spread but with lovely pots coffee. We had the room right next to reception which was a bit small and the air conditioning was so noisy that we had the choice of cool and awake or slightly warm and asleep, but at least we could have the windows open and the shutters closed. Nice quiet location but quite convenient to a bus stop into town. The buses are a bit bumpy on those cobbled streets!

Reviews.Title: “Found no faults at Hotel Kent”
Reviews.Author: katy_durston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a honeymoon trip through Italy. Our criteria for selecting hotels was budget, cleanliness and accessibity of attractions etc. This didn't disappoint. We arrived by train into termini station and walked to the Hotel which took about 20 mins.(this turned out to be unneccesary as a bus ran direct from station to end of via Reggio Emilia) Checked in with ease. The man on the desk (manager?) was extremely helpful. He knew we had a short stay and immediately produced maps and gave us ideas for our three days' itineraries, pointing out the must see attractions etc etc. The room, and the whole hotel was perfectly clean. The chambermaid also doubled as the breakfast server and she was great! Our room was at the back of the hotel and had no view really, local housing and businesses. We slept comfortably with the window open - no noise. The room itself was rreasonably sized and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean & adequate. Breakfast were good. Bread, pastries, jams coffee, juice, cereal. Bus services at the end of the road (on via nomentana) took us right into the thick of the attractions. Even direct to Vatican. Manager helped again in knowing where to buy tickets and what type to get (a little shop on the main road) We ate twice locally - much cheaper than in the centre and lovely food. A short walk to the close by park is a must. Fabulous views over the city. A great place to spend an afternoon out of the bustle and rent a bike for an hour. At the end of our stay we had to check out in the morning, but our flight wasn't until the evening from Ciampino airport. They happily arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport and also kept our bags until we returned from our last days sightseeing and got our taxi. This hotel is out of the way if you wanted to be on the door step of the sights. However a short bus drive away for a peaceful nights sleep and cheaper costs are worth it. ((Recommend during peak season that you arrive early at museums and sights to avoid queues. Colloseum is glorious in the morning sun.))

Reviews.Title: “Decent but noisy”
Reviews.Author: KlondikeKate
Reviews.Content: Very polite staff, clean rooms although small-ish. Good breakfast. Couple of major downsides were that rooms near lift were incredibly noisy and we had to ask that they tried to deter people from using it during the night. Walls are thin and we could hear neighbours in their bathrooms...The advice on a couple of websites that they will arrange transport to airports is false. Area is good for cheaper restaurants and very close to bus into city.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Lesley2006
Reviews.Content: Very good no frills hotel very clean, in a nice part of Rome; Quiet street ; Very near buses. Staff welcoming and helpful; would definitely stay there again. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “central location but very small old rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jessica819
Reviews.Content: the first time we pulled up outside the hotel i could tell it was going to be average. the location was very convenient and all, but the rooms were tiny and very old. the mattress was so soft it gave me a backache. you could only walk around the bed and that's it. the toilet was equally small and when you flush the toilet the noise seems to last forever. but for the price you pay, to stay in rome, i guess you can't complain. stayed at nicer hotels at lower prices so i can't say this hotel is a "must"...............

Reviews.Title: “Beware of free e-mail”
Reviews.Author: idajimmi
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, we were told that we could use the internet free of charge any time. The daytime desk clerk wanted to arrange a shuttle service to FCO airport for us, we declined and at check out he wanted 5 euros for the use of internet.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: indolentleopard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a small street and is directly across from MACRO, which is the contemporary art museum in Rome. The rooms are clean. The staff, (particularly Mustafa) is very, very friendly and eager to help. Breakfast is good (Italian croissants, cappucinos, jams, butter, nutela and melba toast) and you can take a tray up to your room for breakfast in bed. There are several good restaurants in the area, all walking distance. ATM's and internet spot nearby. There is a new massage spa on the same street where I had an excellent hour-long treatment for $35. The Kent Hotel is an ideal choice if you want to keep your costs down and don't mind (we prefer it) not being in the thick of things. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and economical”
Reviews.Author: MaineBecs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Kent was an ideal place to stay while in Rome. We (my boyfriend and I) travelled to Rome for 7 days, and found the Hotel to be a perfect place to situate ourselves. Located in the Borghese Gardens area, it was close to the Porta Pia bus stop and had very easy access to the sights. The restaurants around the area were friendly and less expensive than right in the touristy areas around the Trevi Fountain and Colloseum. The staff was also helpful and we were able to buy train tickets to return to the Airport right at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the previous reviews, Hotel Kent is a great place to stay when in Rome. It's good value for money as accommadation in Rome is very expensive and clean with helpful staff. The area around the hotel takes on a lovely atmosphere in the bars and restaurants at night time too. Basically you get to eat where the Romans eat and not get ripped off in the tourist traps of central Rome. We were forced to stay at Hotel Kent as all other accommadation in Rome was fully booked that weekend. We initially were worried that it was not central enough for the sites but it is a short walk to Porta Pia square where you can catch a bus anywhere. The big bonus for us was that we could leave the mayhem of tourists in downtown Rome and mix with the Romans in the evening. Everyone in central Rome is a tourist so Hotel Kent is a great escape from that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good value and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: AH65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kent with my husband and 13 year old daughter from 6th to 13th July. Although not in town centre we were within walking distance and just round the corner was Porta Pia where we could catch a bus to anywhere in town. The hotel is small but extremely nice and very clean and modern with a/c. Rooms were compact with very comfortable beds and on suite bathrooms with shower and bidet. The continental breakfast was served in a bright airy room and was very pleasant. We enjoyed our stay at the Kent it was great value for money and if you don't mind being off the beaten track a little (which as it turned out we were grateful for as the city centre is always busy and noisy) you couldn't do better than the Kent. The absolute best thing about the Kent is the staff they could not have been nicer or more helpful (especially all the desk guys who answered all our questions and gave excellent directions and advice.)

Reviews.Title: “A 'cozy' hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Kent because every other hotel near the centre of Rome was already booked or very expensive. So it was a compulsory choice. Even though, it is a small hotel, it was recently renovated and the rooms are airy, with clean bathrooms. The area where the breakfast is served is small, but the breakfast itself is plentiful and fresh. All staff are very-very polite. The area is close to the centre of Rome - if you take the bus (approximately 10-15 minutes), but you can also walk (approximately 30 minutes). The district is a little bit "dark" at night but you really need not to worry. In case, you cannot find anything better (in terms of money or place), I would recommend it.
